verses.kjv: Now concerning the things whereof ye wrote unto me: It is good for a man not to touch a woman.
verses.ct: Now, regarding the matters you wrote to me about: it is good for a man to refrain from sexual relations with a woman.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless, to avoid fornication, let every man have his own wife, and let every woman have her own husband.
verses.ct: However, to prevent sexual immorality, each man should have his own wife, and each woman should have her own husband.

verses.kjv: Let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence: and likewise also the wife unto the husband.
verses.ct: The husband should fulfill his marital duty to his wife, and the wife should do the same for her husband.

verses.kjv: The wife hath not power of her own body, but the husband: and likewise also the husband hath not power of his own body, but the wife.
verses.ct: The wife does not have sole authority over her own body — her husband also does. In the same way, the husband does not have sole authority over his own body — his wife also does.

verses.kjv: Defraud ye not one the other, except it be with consent for a time, that ye may give yourselves to fasting and prayer; and come together again, that Satan tempt you not for your incontinency.
verses.ct: Don't deprive each other, unless you both agree to do so for a limited time so you can devote yourselves to fasting and prayer. Then come back together again, so that Satan doesn't tempt you because of your lack of self-control.

verses.kjv: But I speak this by permission, and not of commandment.
verses.ct: I'm saying this as a suggestion, not as a command.

verses.kjv: For I would that all men were even as I myself. But every man hath his proper gift of God, one after this manner, and another after that.
verses.ct: I wish everyone could be like me in this regard. But each person has their own gift from God — one person has this gift, and another has that one.

verses.kjv: I say therefore to the unmarried and widows, It is good for them if they abide even as I.
verses.ct: So to those who are unmarried and to widows, I say this: it is good for them to stay single, as I am.

verses.kjv: But if they cannot contain, let them marry: for it is better to marry than to burn.
verses.ct: But if they can't exercise self-control, they should get married. It's better to marry than to be consumed with desire.

verses.kjv: And unto the married I command, yet not I, but the Lord, Let not the wife depart from her husband:
verses.ct: To those who are married, I give this instruction — and this comes not from me but from the Lord: a wife must not separate from her husband.

verses.kjv: But and if she depart, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled to her husband: and let not the husband put away his wife.
verses.ct: But if she does separate, she must either remain unmarried or reconcile with her husband. And a husband must not divorce his wife.

verses.kjv: But to the rest speak I, not the Lord: If any brother hath a wife that believeth not, and she be pleased to dwell with him, let him not put her away.
verses.ct: To everyone else, I say this — and this is from me, not from the Lord: if a brother has a wife who is not a believer, and she is willing to live with him, he must not divorce her.

verses.kjv: And the woman which hath an husband that believeth not, and if he be pleased to dwell with her, let her not leave him.
verses.ct: And if a woman has a husband who is not a believer, and he is willing to live with her, she must not leave him.

verses.kjv: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband: else were your children unclean; but now are they holy.
verses.ct: Because the unbelieving husband is made holy through his wife, and the unbelieving wife is made holy through her husband. Otherwise your children would be spiritually unclean, but as it is, they are holy.

verses.kjv: But if the unbelieving depart, let him depart. A brother or a sister is not under bondage in such cases: but God hath called us to peace.
verses.ct: But if the unbelieving spouse chooses to leave, let them leave. The brother or sister is not bound in such situations. God has called us to live in peace.

verses.kjv: For what knowest thou, O wife, whether thou shalt save thy husband? or how knowest thou, O man, whether thou shalt save thy wife?
verses.ct: Wife, how do you know whether you will save your husband? Husband, how do you know whether you will save your wife?

verses.kjv: But as God hath distributed to every man, as the Lord hath called every one, so let him walk. And so ordain I in all churches.
verses.ct: In any case, each person should continue living in the situation the Lord has assigned to them, just as God called them. This is the rule I establish in all the churches.

verses.kjv: Is any man called being circumcised? let him not become uncircumcised. Is any called in uncircumcision? let him not be circumcised.
verses.ct: Was someone already circumcised when they were called? They shouldn't try to reverse it. Was someone uncircumcised when they were called? They shouldn't get circumcised.

verses.kjv: Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God.
verses.ct: Circumcision means nothing, and uncircumcision means nothing. What matters is keeping God's commandments.

verses.kjv: Let every man abide in the same calling wherein he was called.
verses.ct: Each person should remain in the situation they were in when God called them.

verses.kjv: Art thou called being a servant? care not for it: but if thou mayest be made free, use it rather.
verses.ct: Were you a slave when you were called? Don't let it trouble you. But if you get the opportunity to gain your freedom, take it.

verses.kjv: For he that is called in the Lord, being a servant, is the Lord’s freeman: likewise also he that is called, being free, is Christ’s servant.
verses.ct: Because a slave who was called by the Lord is the Lord's free person. In the same way, a free person who was called is Christ's slave.

verses.kjv: Ye are bought with a price; be not ye the servants of men.
verses.ct: You were purchased at a price — don't become slaves to human masters.

verses.kjv: Brethren, let every man, wherein he is called, therein abide with God.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, each person should remain with God in the situation they were in when they were called.

verses.kjv: Now concerning virgins I have no commandment of the Lord: yet I give my judgment, as one that hath obtained mercy of the Lord to be faithful.
verses.ct: Regarding those who have never married, I don't have a command from the Lord, but I offer my opinion as someone who has received mercy from the Lord and can be trusted.

verses.kjv: I suppose therefore that this is good for the present distress, I say, that it is good for a man so to be.
verses.ct: Given the current crisis, I think it is best for a person to stay as they are.

verses.kjv: Art thou bound unto a wife? seek not to be loosed. Art thou loosed from a wife? seek not a wife.
verses.ct: Are you committed to a wife? Don't seek to end it. Are you free from a wife? Don't go looking for one.

verses.kjv: But and if thou marry, thou hast not sinned; and if a virgin marry, she hath not sinned. Nevertheless such shall have trouble in the flesh: but I spare you.
verses.ct: But if you do get married, you haven't sinned. And if a young woman who has never married gets married, she hasn't sinned either. However, those who marry will face difficulties in this life, and I'm trying to spare you from that.

verses.kjv: But this I say, brethren, the time is short: it remaineth, that both they that have wives be as though they had none;
verses.ct: What I'm saying, brothers and sisters, is that the time is limited. From now on, those who have wives should live as though they don't;

verses.kjv: And they that weep, as though they wept not; and they that rejoice, as though they rejoiced not; and they that buy, as though they possessed not;
verses.ct: those who grieve, as though they aren't grieving; those who celebrate, as though they aren't celebrating; those who purchase things, as though they own nothing;

verses.kjv: And they that use this world, as not abusing it: for the fashion of this world passeth away.
verses.ct: and those who make use of this world, as though they aren't fully engaged with it. Because the present form of this world is fading away.

verses.kjv: But I would have you without carefulness. He that is unmarried careth for the things that belong to the Lord, how he may please the Lord:
verses.ct: I want you to be free from anxiety. An unmarried man is focused on the Lord's concerns — how to please the Lord.

verses.kjv: But he that is married careth for the things that are of the world, how he may please his wife.
verses.ct: But a married man is focused on worldly concerns — how to please his wife.

verses.kjv: There is difference also between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman careth for the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit: but she that is married careth for the things of the world, how she may please her husband.
verses.ct: There is also a difference between a married woman and an unmarried one. The unmarried woman is focused on the Lord's concerns, so that she may be dedicated in both body and spirit. But the married woman is focused on worldly concerns — how to please her husband.

verses.kjv: And this I speak for your own profit; not that I may cast a snare upon you, but for that which is comely, and that ye may attend upon the Lord without distraction.
verses.ct: I'm telling you this for your own benefit, not to put restrictions on you, but so that you can live in an appropriate way and give your undivided attention to the Lord.

verses.kjv: But if any man think that he behaveth himself uncomely toward his virgin, if she pass the flower of her age, and need so require, let him do what he will, he sinneth not: let them marry.
verses.ct: If anyone feels he is not treating his fiancée properly, and if she is getting past the prime age for marriage and he feels the situation demands it, he should do what he wants — there is no sin in it. Let them get married.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless he that standeth stedfast in his heart, having no necessity, but hath power over his own will, and hath so decreed in his heart that he will keep his virgin, doeth well.
verses.ct: But the man who has firmly made up his mind, who is under no pressure, and who has control over his own desires and has decided in his heart to keep her as his fiancée — that man is doing well.

verses.kjv: So then he that giveth her in marriage doeth well; but he that giveth her not in marriage doeth better.
verses.ct: So then, the one who marries his fiancée does well, but the one who does not marry does even better.

verses.kjv: The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.
verses.ct: A wife is bound to her husband for as long as he lives. But if her husband dies, she is free to marry anyone she wants — as long as it is someone who belongs to the Lord.

verses.kjv: But she is happier if she so abide, after my judgment: and I think also that I have the Spirit of God.
verses.ct: However, in my opinion, she will be happier if she remains as she is. And I believe that I too have the Spirit of God.
